title: PSA: CC is actually NOT equally effective against different champions.
body:
This essay is listed in my ["Master List of Essay Threads"](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/GD/dIOKMXh6-master-list-of-my-essay-threads) under the title "On CC Effects Different Champions Differently"
_____

I see this dumb argument come up so often when literally any effort to think about it reveals the truth: No, actually, different champions have different levels of weakness to cc. In general, there's a sliding scale of effectiveness of cc:

If you cc a squishy short ranged mage/assassin like katarina when she jumps into a team fight she dies and contributes nothing to the fight.

If you cc a 'light fighter' like riven, fiora, or pantheon, they will probably either die outright or be so low that they have to disengage from the team fight they might buy merc treads if they are being cautious of your cc and that could be the difference between them escaping alive from the fight or dying from the first cc.

If you cc a tanky mage like ryze, ekko, or diana you'll probably disrupt their attack patterns and force them to fall back, but they probbably will just hang out behind their backline until their important cooldowns are up and look for a chance to go back in. Their shields, durability, and ability to drop massive damage in under a second is enough reason for them to risk going back in unlike a low hp light fighter who risks just dying before doing anything if they try to reengage.

If you cc a fighter (or 'juggernaught') in a teamfight, you've probably forced them to switch targets but they'll probably not die in the duration of the cc. They also probably have merc treads if your team has a lot of cc so you don't even get the full duration.

If you cc a full tank like nautelous or leona in a team fight, you only delay them for a second or two and then they go back to locking your team down. They probably took no real damage at all during the cc duration. They almost certaintly have merc treads if your team has a lot of cc so you don't even get the full duration.


This is ofc not even considering exceptions such as those with innate tenacity/cc immunity such as irelia, olaf, poppy or those with invulnerability durations such as kayle, tryndamere which make them more or less susceptible to cc. CC olaf at a key moment and force his ult out which makes him squishier, cc trynd or kayle during their ults and they'll die soon after since they build glass and rely on that invulnerability to teamfight.

TLDR: Actually, 'just cc them' IS in fact a viable counterplay option since cc really does impact champions differently. CC an ulting kat to win a teamfight, cc the enemy leona and waste your cooldown (especially if she's already blown her full combo).

Ive said this before, but also get downvoted by idiots who dont comprehend it.

saying Just CC isnt the be all to end all answer, but it means a helluva alot for some champions like Kat, than it does to someone like Malphite.

Except the argument is usually in response to somebody saying "Just CC them", which applies to literally every champion in the game regardless of whether or not it's more or less effective against specific champions.

If we apply your reasoning:
Person 1: Champion X doesn't have counterplay
Person 2: Just CC them
Person 1: That's literally every champion in the game
Person 2: It's more effective against this one though

This is a valid argument, but only because the original claim was too extreme and is objectively falsifiable. It's not so much of an argument as it is a fact. Every champion has some sort of counterplay. The problem is that some champions don't have enough.

This is what a subjective argument might look like:
Person 1: Champion X doesn't have **enough** counterplay
Person 2: Just CC them
Person 1: That's literally every champion in the game
Person 2: It's more effective against this one though
Person 1: This champion has little counterplay aside from CC, which still applies to every champion in the game. There is no counterplay to this specific champion that I would not find on every other champion in the game (the CC and focus arguments).

Yes, CC is a viable counterplay option. The problem is when it's the champion's only counterplay. The less counterplay a champion has, the worse it feels to play against them and the harder it is to shut them down.

The issue is that often times by the time you get to the point where 'just cc them' is one of the only options, you're talking about a 10/0 riven/yi/katarina/yasuo/etc.. At some point you have to take responsability for the earlier fuckups in the game. There were plenty of other times when they were less fed when you could have counterplayed them in other ways, but people want to whine that an overfed glass cannon can blow them up and to those people i say - "just cc them and their gold lead won't matter, all that damage on that yi won't save him, from being 100-0 during a stun'.

They don't have to be ridiculously fed to have little counterplay, nor do they even have to be strong champions. I'm referring to champions whose lack of counterplay stems from their design and not from them obtaining massive gold leads and snowballing the game. Poppy and Yorick, for example, have ridiculously little counterplay and don't need to be fed to feel like shit to play against. When you play against them it feels like you're being beaten due to unfair design rather than from the enemy being better than you. It's part of the reason why they've both been left in a weak state until their reworks come through.

Depends on the CC. Stunning a tank will do very little, but silencing then can do quite a bit. Slowing a mage will do next to nothing, but knocking them into you can basically win a teamfight for you.

Also remember that CC depends on the champion itself as well. If a champion has a lot of escapes then CC will NOT be as effective unless you have immediate burst. 

So if you CC someone with a lot of peel like Yasuo when In front of your minions, Riven, Vayne, Janna, Ziggs, Azir then try to do it when you can Hard burst them since they likely make a lot better getaway than someone like Oriana or Ashe who won't be able to escape once it's over.

I dislike generalizations, but hard CC works against many carry players.  Picking champions that can neither disengage from hard CC nor have hard CC is going to be weaker in this meta.

For example, {{champion:60}}  is stong, {{champion:69}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:96}} are weaker picks.  They're still viable, but you have to build teams around them to keep them safe and let them carry.

If you have no hard CC on your team, it's going to eb a tough go if the other team can either just tank or kite your team around.  CC in many cases is going to be strong if you target the right champs.  So, that should have really been the title of the post.

TLDR; Target the right champs with your CC.  Same goes for damage.

The post title is aimed at the people who always post 'everyone is countered by cc so that isn't relevant' in threads about yi, katarina, riven, etc. anytime someone brings up that a single hard cc would get that champ killed even if fed super hard in a team fight.

I fully approve of this OP, I've long claimed that champs have different sensitivity to cc, and thus the "just cc" argument has different validity depending on whom the target is. 

Kata whom several already have named is probably the most obvious champion in the game to "just cc", since it more or less wrecks her given she isn't fed enough to 100-0 your carries before the cc lands (some cc do have some kind of delay before landing). Take Taric for an instance, his E missile speed is quite slow, so given he uses it from max range it sometimes won't be enough to save your carries, thus I'd say quick or instant cc's, like a Malph ult, Vi Q or Annie's Tibbers/W, are probably more reliable for shutting her down. Ofc, Taric can work just as fine, given you time your engage/peel very well, but I personally feel it's harder, just something to think about.

I agree. I wouldn't tell people to "just cc and focus" a Darius like you would a Kat, because Darius wants to be in the middle of everyone brawling it out. Taking out someone like Darius is more about protecting your DPS and not getting dunked and letting him go off.

The actual range of the person you are CCing is unimportant.  What matters is if they are in _your_ range.  If I am Vel'Koz, then CC on an enemy Yi is no more effective than CC on any enemy I could kill in one rotation or less (such as an Azir or Xerath).
But if the're melee and get cc'd, chances are they are gonna be in the range of a lot more of your teamates then if they were lux and got cc'd, just because of how the champion needs to be played.

I think you could also point out the differences between hard and soft CC
Ex: Stun Katarina and she can't pull out her combo, therefore, she is vulnerable and will most likely die. However, slowing Katarina doesn't affect her combat capabilities as she can most likely shunpo enough times to virtually cancel out the effect and deal her full combo (only effective when there are no units nearby to shunpo to/ shunpo is on cd).
Soft cc is actually better at dealing with tanks since it tends to be longer duration and more spammable. Olaf axes will peel enemy tanks much better than an ahri charm for example.
